parent.description: Required. Name of the workflow for which an execution should be created. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/workflows/{workflow} The latest revision of the workflow will be used.

create.description: Creates a new execution using the latest revision of the given workflow.

name.description: Required. Name of the execution to be retrieved. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/workflows/{workflow}/executions/{execution}

enumDescriptions: Includes only basic metadata about the execution. Following fields are returned: name, start_time, end_time, state and workflow_revision_id.
view.description: Optional. A view defining which fields should be filled in the returned execution. The API will default to the FULL view.

get.description: Returns an execution of the given name.

cancel.description: Cancels an execution of the given name.

name.description: Required. Name of the execution to be cancelled. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/workflows/{workflow}/executions/{execution}

list.description: Returns a list of executions which belong to the workflow with the given name. The method returns executions of all workflow revisions. Returned executions are ordered by their start time (newest first).

pageSize.description: Maximum number of executions to return per call. Max supported value depends on the selected Execution view: it's 10000 for BASIC and 100 for FULL. The default value used if the field is not specified is 100, regardless of the selected view. Values greater than the max value will be coerced down to it.

view.description: Optional. A view defining which fields should be filled in the returned executions. The API will default to the BASIC view.
enumDescriptions: Includes only basic metadata about the execution. Following fields are returned: name, start_time, end_time, state and workflow_revision_id.

parent.description: Required. Name of the workflow for which the executions should be listed. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/workflows/{workflow}

pageToken.description: A page token, received from a previous `ListExecutions` call. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page. When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListExecutions` must match the call that provided the page token.

description: Execute workflows created with Workflows API.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

StackTrace.description: A collection of stack elements (frames) where an error occurred.

column.description: The source code column position (of the line) the current instruction was generated from.

length.description: The length in bytes of text in this character group, e.g. digits of a number, string length, or AST (abstract syntax tree) node.

line.description: The source code line number the current instruction was generated from.

Position.description: Position contains source position information about the stack trace element such as line number, column number and length of the code block in bytes.

StackTraceElement.description: A single stack element (frame) where an error occurred.

step.description: The step the error occurred at.

routine.description: The routine where the error occurred.

position.description: The source position information of the stacktrace element.

Error.description: Error describes why the execution was abnormally terminated.

stackTrace.description: Stack trace with detailed information of where error was generated.

payload.description: Error message and data returned represented as a JSON string.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

executions.description: The executions which match the request.

startTime.description: Output only. Marks the beginning of execution.

endTime.description: Output only. Marks the end of execution, successful or not.

workflowRevisionId.description: Output only. Revision of the workflow this execution is using.

result.description: Output only. Output of the execution represented as a JSON string. The value can only be present if the execution's state is `SUCCEEDED`.

name.description: Output only. The resource name of the execution. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/workflows/{workflow}/executions/{execution}

argument.description: Input parameters of the execution represented as a JSON string. The size limit is 32KB. *Note*: If you are using the REST API directly to run your workflow, you must escape any JSON string value of `argument`. Example: `'{"argument":"{\"firstName\":\"FIRST\",\"lastName\":\"LAST\"}"}'`

state.description: Output only. Current state of the execution.
enumDescriptions: The execution failed with an error.

error.description: Output only. The error which caused the execution to finish prematurely. The value is only present if the execution's state is `FAILED` or `CANCELLED`.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

title: Workflow Executions API
name: workflowexecutions
